comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Dorothy D. Smith (1903-1995) of Newton Centre, Massachusetts, began her archery competitions at the age of nine. The daughter of Mr. & Mrs. Louis C. Smith, both of whom were notable archers, Dorothy was the National Archery Association Women's Champion in 1919, 1921, 1922, 1924, 1925, 1926 and 1931, and was an eleven-time winner of the Eastern Archery Association title. She later married Henry S.C. Cummings and was inducted into the Archery Hall of Fame. – [1] [2] [3]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See www.usaarcheryrecords.org/History/scrapbook1912/index.html for more archery photos from this period.
